official-title.#text: To refer H.R. 3068, a bill making congressional reference to the United States Court of Federal Claims pursuant to sections

external-xref.#tail: of title 28, United States Code, the Indian trust-related claims of the Grand Traverse Band of Ottawa and Chippewa Indians of Michigan as well as its individual members.

sponsor.#tail: submitted the following resolution; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , is referred to the chief judge of the
for a determination as to whether the tribe and its members have Indian trust-related legal or equitable claims against the United States other than the legal claims that are pending in the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: United States Court of Federal Claims

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: on the date of enactment of this resolution.

text.#text: Upon receipt of the bill, the chief judge shall—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , notwithstanding the bar of any statute of limitations; and

text.#text: proceed according to the provisions of

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , at the earliest practicable date, providing—

of the nature, extent, and character of the Indian-trust related claims of the Grand Traverse Band of Ottawa and Chippewa Indians of Michigan and its tribal members for compensation as legal or equitable claims against the United States other than the legal claims that are pending in the
on the date of enactment of this resolution; and

text.#text: findings of fact and conclusions of law that are sufficient to inform the
the amount, if any, legally or equitably due from the United States to the claimants.
